   20: 
   21: -module(erl_expand_records_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: %%-define(debug, true).
   24: 
   25: -ifdef(debug).
   26: -define(line, put(line, ?LINE), ).
   27: -define(config(X,Y), foo).
   28: -define(privdir, "erl_expand_records_SUITE_priv").
   29: -define(t, test_server).
   30: -else.
   31: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   32: -define(privdir, proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)).
   33: -endif.
   34: 
   35: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   36: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2, 
   37: 	 init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   38: 
   39: -export([attributes/1, expr/1, guard/1,
   40:          init/1, pattern/1, strict/1, update/1,
   41: 	 otp_5915/1, otp_7931/1, otp_5990/1,
   42: 	 otp_7078/1, maps/1, zlc/1,
   43:          side_effects/1]).
   44: 
   45: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
   46:     Config.
   47: 
   48: end_per_testcase(_Case, _Config) ->
   49:     ok.
   50: 
   51: suite() ->
   52:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   53:      {timetrap,{minutes,1}}].
   54: 
   55: all() -> 
   56:     [attributes, expr, guard, init,
   57:      pattern, strict, update, maps,
   58:      side_effects, zlc, {group, tickets}].
   59: 
   60: groups() -> 
   61:     [{tickets, [],
   62:       [otp_5915, otp_7931, otp_5990, otp_7078]}].
   63: 
   64: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   65:     Config.
   66: 
   67: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   68:     ok.
   69: 
   70: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   71:     Config.
   72: 
   73: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   74:     Config.
   75: 
   76: 
   77: %% Import module and functions.
   78: attributes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   79:     Ts = [
   80: 	  <<"-import(lists, [append/2, reverse/1]).
   81: 
   82:          -record(r, {a,b}).
   83: 
   84: t() ->
   85:     [2,1] = reverse(append([1],[2])),
   86:     3 = length([1,2,3]),
   87:     3 = record_info(size, r),
   88:     [a, b] = record_info(fields, r),
   89:     [_|_] = erl_expand_records_SUITE:all(),
   90:     ok.
   91: ">>
   92:       ],
   93:     run(Config, Ts),
   94:     ok.
   95:     
   96: %% Some expressions.
   97: expr(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   98:     Ts = [
   99:       <<"
  100:          -record(r, {a,b,c}).
  101: 
  102:          t() ->
  103:              [1,2] = [R#r.a || R <- [#r{a = 1}, #r{a = 2}, #r{a = 3}],
  104:                                R#r.a < 3],
  105:              [1,2] = [R#r.a || R <- [#r{a = 1}, #r{a = 2}, #r{a = 3}],
  106:                                begin R#r.a < 3 end],
  107:              [1,2,3] = [R#r.a || R <- [#r{a = 1}, #r{a = 2}, #r{a = 3}],
  108:                                  begin is_record(R, r) end],
  109:              [1,2,3] = [R#r.a || R <- [#r{a = 1}, #r{a = 2}, #r{a = 3}],
  110:                                  begin erlang:is_record(R, r) end],
  111:              ok.
  112:       ">>,
  113:       <<"
  114:          -record(r, {a,b,c}).
  115: 
  116:          f(X) -> X.
  117: 
  118:          t() ->
  119:              A = {$c, 1, 3.14, a, \"hi\", [], [a,b]},
  120:              R = #r{a = element(6, A), b = #r.b},
  121:              3 = R#r.b,
  122:              <<1:8>> = <<(begin erlang:element(2, A) end):8>>,
  123:              self() ! {a, message, []},
  124:              One = 1 = fun f/1(1),
  125:              2 = fun(X) -> X end(One + One),
  126:              3 = fun exprec_test:f/1(3),
  127:              4 = exprec_test:f(4),
  128:              5 = f(5),
  129:              L = receive 
  130:                      {a,message,L0} ->
  131:                          L0
  132:                  end,
  133:              case catch a:foo(bar) of
  134:                  {'EXIT', _} -> ok
  135:              end,
  136:              _ = receive 			%Suppress warning.
  137:                     noop ->
  138:                        1/(length(L) - 0)
  139:                  after 0 ->
  140:                     ok
  141:                  end,
  142:              if 
  143:                  R#r.c =:= undefined ->
  144:                      ok;
  145:                  true ->
  146:                      not_ok
  147:              end.
  148: 
  149:          is_record(_, _, _) ->
  150:              error(wrong_is_record).
  151:       ">>,
  152:       <<"
  153:          -record(foo, {bar = [Bar || Bar <- ?MODULE:id([]), size(Bar) > 0]}).
  154: 
  155:          t() ->
  156:              {'EXIT',{{bad_filter,{foo,[]}},[_|_]}} = catch gh6501a(whatever),
  157:              [whatever] = gh6501b(whatever),
  158:              ok.
  159: 
  160:          gh6501a(Bar) ->
  161:              [Bar || #foo{}].
  162: 
  163:          gh6501b(Bar) ->
  164:              [Bar || is_tuple(#foo{})].
  165: 
  166:          id(I) -> I.
  167:       ">>
  168:       ],
  169: 
  170:     %% The code above should run equally well with and without
  171:     %% strict record tests.
  172:     run(Config, Ts, [no_strict_record_tests]),
  173:     run(Config, Ts, [strict_record_tests]),
  174:     
  175:     ok.
  176:     
  177: %% is_record in guards.
  178: guard(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  179:     File = filename("guard.erl", Config),
  180:     Beam = filename("guard.beam", Config),
  181:     Test = <<"-module(guard).
  182: 
  183:               -export([t/1]).
  184: 
  185:               -record(r, {a,b}).
  186: 
  187:               t(_) when is_record(3, r) ->
  188:                   1;
  189:               t(_) when is_record(a, r) ->
  190:                   2;
  191:               t(_) when is_record(3.14, r) ->
  192:                   3;
  193:               t(_) when is_record([], r) ->
  194:                   4;
  195:               t(_) when is_record([a], r) ->
  196:                   5;
  197:               t(_) when is_record($a, r) ->
  198:                   6;
  199:               t(_) when is_record(\"foo\", r) ->
  200:                   7;
  201:               t(_) when is_record(#r.a, r) ->
  202:                   8;
  203:               t(_) when is_record(<<\"foo\">>, r) -> % line 23
  204:                   9;
  205:               t(_) when is_record(1 + 2, r) ->
  206:                   10;
  207:               t(_) when is_record(+ 3, r) ->
  208:                   11;
  209:               t(_) ->
  210:                   12.
  211:              ">>,
  212: 
  213:     ok = file:write_file(File, Test),
  214:     {ok, guard, Ws} = compile:file(File, [return,{outdir,?privdir}]),
  215:     Warnings = [L || {_File,WL} <- Ws, {L,sys_core_fold,{nomatch,guard}} <- WL],
  216:     [{7,15}, {9,15}, {11,15}, {13,15}, {15,15}, {17,15},
  217:      {19,15}, {21,15}, {23,15}, {25,15}, {27,15}] = Warnings,
  218: 
  219:     ok = file:delete(File),
  220:     ok = file:delete(Beam),
  221:     ok.
  222: 
  223: %% Wildcard initialisation.
  224: init(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  225:     Ts = [
  226:           ~"""
  227:           -record(r, {a,b,c,d = foo}).
  228: 
  229:           t() ->
  230:               R = #r{_ = init, b = b},
  231:               #r{c = init, b = b, a = init} = R,
  232:               case R of
  233:                   #r{b = b, _ = init} -> ok;
  234:                   _ -> not_ok
  235:               end.
  236:           """,
  237:           ~"""
  238:             -record(r0, {a}).
  239:             -record(r1, {rf1 = (#r0{a = #{ok => ok || ok}})}).
  240: 
  241:             t() ->
  242:                 catch <<0 || #r1{}>>,
  243:                 ok.
  244:             """,
  245:           ~"""
  246:             -record(r0, {a}).
  247:             -record(r1, {
  248:                          rf1 = fun
  249:                                    (+0.0) ->
  250:                                        (list_to_bitstring(ok))#r0.a;
  251:                                    (_) when ok ->
  252:                                        ok
  253:                                end
  254:                         }).
  255: 
  256:             t() ->
  257:                 catch <<0 || (#r1{})>>,
  258:                 ok.
  259:             """,
  260:           ~"""
  261:            -record(r0, {a}).
  262:            -record(r1, {
  263:                         a = {
  264:                              ((ok)#r0{})#r0.a,
  265:                              case whatever of
  266:                                    _ when cucumber ->
  267:                                        banan
  268:                                end
  269:                               }
  270:                        }).
  271: 
  272:            t() ->
  273:                catch #{ok => ok || #r1{}},
  274:                ok.
  275:            """
  276:          ],
  277:     run(Config, Ts),
  278:     ok.
  279: 
  280: %% Some patterns.
  281: pattern(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  282:     Ts = [
  283:       <<"-import(lists, [append/2, reverse/1]).
  284: 
  285:          -record(r, {a,b}).
  286: 
  287:          t() ->
  288:              1 = t(#r{}),
  289:              2 = t($a),
  290:              3 = t(1000),
  291:              4 = t({1000}),
  292:              5 = t(3),
  293:              6 = t(-3.14),
  294:              7 = t({4.0}),
  295:              8 = t(3.14),
  296:              9 = t(\"str\"),
  297:              10 = t([]),
  298:              11 = t([a|b]),
  299:              12 = t(\"string\"),
  300:              13 = t({[]}),
  301:              14 = t({a,b}),
  302:              15 = t({{}}),
  303:              16 = t({tuple,tupel}),
  304:              17 = t(4),
  305:              18 = t(10),
  306:              19 = t({a}),
  307:              20 = t(<<100:8,220:8>>),
  308:              21 = t(#r{a = #r{}}),
  309:              22 = t(2),
  310:              23 = t(#r{a = #r{}, b = b}),
  311:              24 = t(abc),
  312:              ok.
  313: 
  314:          t(abc) ->
  315:              24;
  316:          t($a) ->
  317:              2;
  318:          t(3) ->
  319:              5;
  320:          t(3.14) ->
  321:              8;
  322:          t(\"str\") ->
  323:              9;
  324:          t([]) ->
  325:              10;
  326:          t([a|b]) ->
  327:              11;
  328:          t(L) when is_list(L) ->
  329:              12;
  330:          t({L}) when is_list(L) ->
  331:              13;
  332:          t({a,b}) ->
  333:              14;
  334:          t({T}) when is_tuple(T) ->
  335:              15;
  336:          t(+ 4) ->
  337:              17;
  338:          t(3+7) ->
  339:              18;
  340:          t(<<A:8, (100+120):8>>) when A =:= 100 ->
  341:              20;
  342:          t(#r{a = #r{}, b = undefined}) ->
  343:              21;
  344:          t(#r.a) ->
  345:              22;
  346:          t(A) when is_record(A, r), is_record(element(2, A), r) ->
  347:              23;
  348:          t(A) when is_record(A, r) ->
  349:              1;
  350:          t(I) when is_integer(I) ->
  351:              3;
  352:          t({I}) when is_integer(I) ->
  353:              4;
  354:          t({F}) when is_float(F) ->
  355:              7;
  356:          t({A} = B) when A < B ->
  357:              19;
  358:          t(F) when is_float(F) ->
  359:              6;
  360:          t(T) when is_tuple(T) ->
  361:              16.
  362:       ">>
  363:       ],
  364:     run(Config, Ts),
  365:     ok.
  366:     
  367: strict(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  368:     Ts1 = [
  369:       <<"-record(r1, {a,b}).
  370:          -record(r2, {a,b}).
  371: 
  372:          t() ->
  373:              A = #r1{a = 1, b = 2},
  374:              ok = try 
  375:                       {1, 2} = {A#r2.a, A#r2.b},
  376:                       not_ok
  377:                   catch error:{badrecord,{r1,1,2}} -> ok
  378:                   end,
  379:              try
  380:                  case foo of
  381:                      _ when A#r2.a =:= 1 -> not_ok
  382:                  end
  383:              catch error:_ -> ok
  384:              end.
  385:          element(_, _) ->
  386:              error(wrong_element).
  387:       ">>
  388:       ],
  389:     run(Config, Ts1, [strict_record_tests]),
  390: 
  391:     Ts2 = [
  392:       <<"-record(r1, {a,b}).
  393:          -record(r2, {a,b}).
  394: 
  395:          t() ->
  396:              A = #r1{a = 1, b = 2},
  397:              {1, 2} = {A#r2.a, A#r2.b},
  398:              case foo of
  399:                  _ when A#r2.a =:= 1 -> ok
  400:              end.
  401:          element(_, _) ->
  402:              error(wrong_element).
  403:       ">>
  404:       ],
  405:     run(Config, Ts2, [no_strict_record_tests]),
  406:     ok.
  407:     
  408: %% Record updates.
  409: update(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  410:     Ts = [
  411:       <<"-record(r, {a,b,c,d,e,f}).
  412: 
  413:          t() ->
  414:              R0 = #r{},
  415:              R1 = R0#r{a = #r.a, e = {x,y}},
  416:              2 = R1#r.a,
  417:              R2 = R1#r{},
  418:              true = R1 =:= R2,
  419:              R3 = R2#r{c = fun(X) -> X end, 
  420:                        d = <<\"foo\">>, 
  421:                        e = [x,y,z], 
  422:                        f = {R0,R1}},
  423:              R4 = R3#r{a = R3#r{b = #r{}}},
  424:              true = erlang:is_record((R4#r.a)#r.b, r),
  425:              #r{a = R0, b = 3, c = 3.14, d = [], e = [[]], f = [{}]} = 
  426:                  R4#r{a = R0, b = 3, c = 3.14, d = [], e = [[]], f = [{}]},
  427:              ok.
  428: 
  429:          %% Just playing around a bit...
  430:          t1() ->
  431:              ((#r{a = (#r{b = #r{}})#r{a = #r{}}})#r{b = #r{}})#r{c = #r{}}.
  432: 
  433:          t2() ->
  434:              R0 = #r{},
  435:              #r{_ = R0#r{a = ok}}.
  436: 
  437:          %% Implicit calls to setelement/3 must go to the BIF,
  438:          %% not to this function.
  439:          setelement(_, _, _) ->
  440:              erlang:error(wrong_setelement_called).
  441:       ">>
  442:       ],
  443:     run(Config, Ts),
  444:     ok.
  445: 
  446: maps(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  447:     Ts = [<<"-record(rr, {a,b,c}).
  448:              t() ->
  449:                  R0 = id(#rr{a=1,b=2,c=3}),
  450:                  R1 = id(#rr{a=4,b=5,c=6}),
  451:                  [{R0,R1}] =
  452:                      maps:to_list(#{#rr{a=1,b=2,c=3} => #rr{a=4,b=5,c=6}}),
  453:                  #{#rr{a=1,b=2,c=3} := #rr{a=1,b=2,c=3}} =
  454:                      #{#rr{a=1,b=2,c=3} => R1}#{#rr{a=1,b=2,c=3} := R0},
  455:                  ok.
  456: 
  457:              id(X) -> X.
  458:             ">>],
  459:     run(Config, Ts, [strict_record_tests]),
  460:     ok.
  461: 
  462: zlc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  463:     Ts = [<<"-record(rr, {a,b,c}).
  464:              t() -> R0 = id(#rr{a=[{X,Y}||X <- [1,2] && Y <- [a,b]]}),
  465:              ok.
  466:              id(X) -> X.
  467:             ">>],
  468:     run(Config, Ts, [strict_record_tests]),
  469:     ok.
  470: 
  471: %% Strict record tests in guards.
  472: otp_5915(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  473:     %% These tests are also run by the compiler's record_SUITE.
  474:     Ts = [
  475:       <<"-record(r, {a = 4,b}).
  476:          -record(r1, {a,b}).
  477:          -record(r2, {a = #r1{},b,c=length([1,2,3])}).
  478:          -record(r3, {a = fun(_) -> #r1{} end(1), b}).
  479: 
  480:          t() ->
  481:              foo = fun(A) when A#r1.a > A#r1.b -> foo end(#r1{b = 2}),
  482:              0 = fun(A) when A#r2.a -> 0 end(#r2{a = true}),
  483:              1 = fun(A) when (#r1{a = A})#r1.a > 2 -> 1 end(3),
  484:              2 = fun(N) when ((#r2{a = #r{a = 4}, b = length([a,b,c])})#r2.a)#r.a > N ->
  485:                          2 end(2),
  486:              3 = fun(A) when (A#r2.a)#r1.a =:= 3 -> 3 end(#r2{a = #r1{a = 3}}),
  487:              ok = fun() ->
  488:                           F = fun(A) when is_record(A#r.a, r1) -> 4;
  489:                                  (A) when is_record(A#r1.a, r1) -> 5
  490:                               end,
  491:                           5 = F(#r1{a = #r1{}}),
  492:                           4 = F(#r{a = #r1{}}),
  493:                           ok
  494:                   end(),
  495:              3 = fun(A) when is_record(A#r1.a, r),
  496:                                    (A#r1.a)#r.a > 3 -> 3
  497:                  end(#r1{a = #r{a = 4}}),
  498:              7 = fun(A) when is_record(A#r3.a, r1) -> 7 end(#r3{}),
  499:              [#r1{a = 2,b = 1}] = 
  500:                  fun() ->
  501:                          [A || A <- [#r1{a = 1, b = 3}, 
  502:                                      #r2{a = 2,b = 1}, 
  503:                                      #r1{a = 2, b = 1}],
  504:                                A#r1.a > 
  505:                                    A#r1.b]
  506:                  end(),
  507:              {[_],b} = 
  508:                  fun(L) ->
  509:                          %% A is checked only once:
  510:                          R1 = [{A,B} || A <- L, A#r1.a, B <- L, A#r1.b],
  511:                          A = #r2{a = true},
  512:                          %% A is checked again:
  513:                          B = if A#r1.a -> a; true -> b end,
  514:                          {R1,B}
  515:                  end([#r1{a = true, b = true}]),
  516: 
  517:              p = fun(A) when (A#r1.a =:= 2) or (A#r2.a =:= 1) -> o;
  518:                     (_) -> p
  519:                  end(#r1{a = 2}),
  520: 
  521:              o = fun(A) when (A#r1.a =:= 2) orelse (A#r2.a =:= 1) -> o;
  522:                     (_) -> p
  523:                  end(#r1{a = 2}),
  524: 
  525:              3 = fun(A) when A#r1.a > 3, 
  526:                              is_record(A, r1) -> 3
  527:                  end(#r1{a = 5}),
  528: 
  529:              ok = fun() ->
  530:                           F = fun(A) when (A#r2.a =:= 1) orelse (A#r2.a) -> 2;
  531:                                  (A) when (A#r1.a =:= 1) orelse (A#r1.a) -> 1;
  532:                                  (A) when (A#r2.a =:= 2) andalso (A#r2.b) -> 3
  533:                               end,
  534:                           1 = F(#r1{a = 1}),
  535:                           2 = F(#r2{a = true}),
  536:                           3 = F(#r2{a = 2, b = true}),
  537:                           ok
  538:                   end(),
  539: 
  540:              b = fun(A) when false or not (A#r.a =:= 1) -> a;
  541:                     (_) -> b
  542:                  end(#r1{a = 1}),
  543:              b = fun(A) when not (A#r.a =:= 1) or false -> a;
  544:                     (_) -> b
  545:                  end(#r1{a = 1}),
  546: 
  547:              ok = fun() ->
  548:                           F = fun(A) when not (A#r.a =:= 1) -> yes;
  549:                                  (_) -> no
  550:                               end,
  551:                           no = F(#r1{a = 2}),
  552:                           yes = F(#r{a = 2}),
  553:                           no = F(#r{a = 1}),
  554:                           ok
  555:                   end(),
  556: 
  557:              a = fun(A) when erlang:is_record(A, r),
  558:                              A#r.a =:= 1,
  559:                              A#r.b =:= 2 -> a
  560:                  end(#r{a = 1, b = 2}),
  561:              a = fun(A) when is_record(A, r),
  562:                              A#r.a =:= 1,
  563:                              A#r.b =:= 2 -> a
  564:                  end(#r{a = 1, b = 2}),
  565: 
  566:              nop = fun(A) when (is_record(A, r1) and (A#r1.a > 3)) or (A#r2.a < 1) ->
  567:                            japp;
  568:                       (_) ->
  569:                            nop
  570:                    end(#r2{a = 0}),
  571:              nop = fun(A) when (A#r1.a > 3) or (A#r2.a < 1) -> japp;
  572:                       (_) ->
  573:                            nop
  574:                    end(#r2{a = 0}),
  575: 
  576:              ok = fun() ->
  577:                           F = fun(A) when (A#r1.a =:= 2) or (A#r2.a =:= 1) -> o;
  578:                                  (_) -> p
  579:                               end,
  580:                           p = F(#r2{a = 1}),
  581:                           p = F(#r1{a = 2}),
  582:                           ok
  583:                   end(),
  584: 
  585:              ok = fun() ->
  586:                           F = fun(A) when fail, A#r1.a; A#r1.a -> ab;
  587:                                  (_) -> bu
  588:                               end,
  589:                           ab = F(#r1{a = true}),
  590:                           bu = F(#r2{a = true}),
  591:                           ok
  592:                   end(),
  593: 
  594:              both = fun(A) when A#r.a, A#r.b -> both 
  595:                     end(#r{a = true, b = true}),
  596: 
  597:              ok = fun() ->
  598:                           F = fun(A, B) when ((A#r1.a) orelse (B#r2.a)) 
  599:                                              or (B#r2.b) or (A#r1.b) -> true;
  600:                                  (_, _) -> false
  601:                               end,
  602:                           true = F(#r1{a = false, b = false}, #r2{a = false, b = true}),
  603:                           false = F(#r1{a = true, b = true}, #r1{a = false, b = true}),
  604:                           ok
  605:                   end(),
  606: 
  607:              ok.
  608:       ">>
  609:       ],
  610:     run(Config, Ts, [strict_record_tests]),
  611:     ok.
  612: 
  613: %% Test optimization of record accesses and is_record/3 tests in guards.
  614: otp_7931(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  615:     Ts = [
  616:       <<"-record(r, {a = 4,b}).
  617:          -record(r1, {a,b}).
  618:          -record(r2, {a = #r1{},b,c=length([1,2,3])}).
  619:          -record(r3, {a = fun(_) -> #r1{} end(1), b}).
  620: 
  621:          t() ->
  622:              ok = fun() ->
  623:                     F = fun(F, [H,H|T]) when is_record(H, r) ->
  624:                                 [H|F(F, T)];
  625:                              (F, [H|T]) when is_record(H, r) ->
  626:                                 [H|F(F, T)];
  627:                              (_, []) -> []
  628:                           end,
  629:                     [#r{a=4,b=7},#r{a=1,b=42}] =
  630:                        F(F, [#r{a=4,b=7},#r{a=4,b=7},#r{a=1,b=42}]),
  631:                     {'EXIT',_} = (catch F(F, [#r1{}])),
  632:                     ok
  633:                   end(),
  634: 
  635:              true = fun() ->
  636:                       R = #r{},
  637:                       if is_record(R, r) -> true; true -> false end
  638:                      end(),
  639: 
  640:              ok = fun() ->
  641:                       F = fun(true, B) when B#r1.a -> ok;
  642:                              (false, _) -> error
  643:                       end,
  644:                       ok = F(true, #r1{a=true}),
  645:                       error = F(false, anything_goes),
  646:                       {'EXIT',_} = (catch F(true, #r1{})),
  647:                       {'EXIT',_} = (catch F(true, #r{})),
  648:                       ok
  649:                   end(),
  650: 
  651: 	     ok = fun() ->
  652: 		      F = fun([{a,R}=T]) when R#r.a =:= 42 ->
  653:                                    {ok,tuple_size(T)};
  654: 			     ([{a,R}=T]) when R#r1.a =:= 7 ->
  655:                                    {ok,tuple_size(T)};
  656: 			     (_) -> error
  657: 		          end,
  658: 		      {ok,2} = F([{a,#r{a=42}}]),
  659: 		      {ok,2} = F([{a,#r1{a=7}}]),
  660: 		      error = F([{a,#r1{}}]),
  661: 		      error = F({a,b,c}),
  662: 		      error = F([]),
  663: 		      ok
  664: 	     end(),
  665: 
  666: 	     ok = fun() ->
  667: 		      F = fun(X, Y, Z) when is_record(X, r1) andalso
  668:                                             (is_record(Y, r2) orelse
  669:                                              is_record(Z, r3)) -> true;
  670: 			     (_, _, _) -> false
  671: 		          end,
  672: 		      true = F(#r1{}, #r2{}, #r3{}),
  673:  		      true = F(#r1{}, #r2{}, blurf),
  674:  		      true = F(#r1{}, blurf, #r3{}),
  675:  		      false = F(#r1{}, blurf, blurf),
  676: 		      false = F(blurf, #r2{}, #r3{}),
  677:  		      false = F(blurf, #r2{}, blurf),
  678:  		      false = F(blurf, blurf, #r3{}),
  679:  		      false = F(blurf, blurf, blurf),
  680: 		      ok
  681: 	     end(),
  682: 
  683: 	     ok = fun() ->
  684: 		      F = fun(R=#r{a=42}) when R#r.b =:= 7 ->
  685:                                    {ok,R};
  686: 			     (_) -> error
  687: 		          end,
  688: 		      {ok,#r{a=42,b=7}} = F(#r{a=42,b=7}),
  689: 		      error = F(#r{}),
  690: 		      error = F([a,b,c]),
  691: 		      ok
  692: 	     end(),
  693: 
  694:              ok.
  695:       ">>
  696:       ],
  697:     run(Config, Ts, [strict_record_tests]),
  698:     ok.
  699: 
  700: %% OTP-5990. {erlang,is_record}.
  701: otp_5990(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  702:     Ts = [
  703:       <<"
  704:          -record(r, {a,b,c}).
  705: 
  706:          t() ->
  707:              [1,2,3] = [R#r.a || R <- [#r{a = 1}, #r{a = 2}, #r{a = 3}],
  708:                                  begin {erlang,is_record}(R, r) end],
  709:              [1,2,3] = [R#r.a || R <- [#r{a = 1}, #r{a = 2}, #r{a = 3}],
  710:                                  begin {erlang,is_record}(R, r) end],
  711:              ok.
  712:       ">>,
  713: 
  714:       <<"
  715:          -record('OrdSet', {orddata = {},
  716:                             ordtype = {}}).
  717: 
  718:          to_sets(S) when is_tuple(S#'OrdSet'.ordtype) ->
  719:              ok.
  720: 
  721:          lc(S) ->
  722:              [X || X <- [S], is_tuple(X#'OrdSet'.ordtype)].
  723: 
  724:          t() ->
  725:              S = #'OrdSet'{},
  726:              ok = to_sets(S),
  727:              [S] = lc(S),
  728:              ok.
  729:       ">>
  730:       ],
  731:     run(Config, Ts, [strict_record_tests]),
  732:     ok.
  733:         
  734: 
  735: %% OTP-7078. Record update: missing test.
  736: otp_7078(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  737:     Ts = [
  738:       <<"
  739:          -record(r, {f}).
  740:          -record(r2, {}).
  741: 
  742:          t() ->
  743:              {'EXIT',_} = (catch (#r2{})#r{}),
  744:              {'EXIT',_} = (catch (#r2{})#r{f = 2}),
  745:              ok.
  746:       ">>,
  747: 
  748:       <<"
  749:          -record(r, {f}).
  750: 
  751:          maker(F) -> 
  752:              put(a, get(a)+1),
  753:              #r{f = F}.
  754: 
  755:          t() ->
  756:              put(a, 0),
  757:              (maker(2))#r{},
  758:              1 = get(a),
  759:              ok.
  760:       ">>
  761: 
  762:       ],
  763:     run(Config, Ts, [strict_record_tests]),
  764:     ok.
  765: 
  766: id(I) -> I.
  767: 
  768: -record(side_effects, {a,b,c}).
  769: 
  770: %% Make sure that the record expression is only evaluated once.
  771: side_effects(_Config) ->
  772:     init_counter(),
  773: 
  774:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,0},_}} = catch (id(bump_counter()))#side_effects{a=1},
  775:     1 = read_counter(),
  776: 
  777:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,1},_}} = catch (id(bump_counter()))#side_effects.b,
  778:     2 = read_counter(),
  779: 
  780:     ok.
  781: 
  782: init_counter() ->
  783:     put(counter, 0).
  784: 
  785: bump_counter() ->
  786:     put(counter, get(counter) + 1).
  787: 
  788: read_counter() ->
  789:     get(counter).
  790: 
  791: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  792: 
  793: run(Config, Tests) ->
  794:     run(Config, Tests, []).
  795: 
  796: run(Config, Tests, Opts) ->
  797:     F = fun(P) ->
  798:                 {SourceFile, Mod} = compile_file_mod(Config),
  799:                 _ = compile_file(Config, P, Opts),
  800:                 AbsFile = filename:rootname(SourceFile, ".erl"),
  801:                 code:purge(Mod),
  802:                 code:load_abs(AbsFile, Mod),
  803:                 case catch Mod:t() of
  804:                     {'EXIT', _Reason} = Error ->
  805:                         io:format("failed, got ~p~n", [Error]),
  806:                         fail();
  807:                     ok ->
  808:                         ok
  809:                 end
  810:         end,
  811:     lists:foreach(F, Tests).
  812: 
  813: %% Compiles a test module and returns the list of errors and warnings.
  814: 
  815: compile_file(Config, Test0, Opts0) ->
  816:     {File, _Mod} = compile_file_mod(Config),
  817:     Filename = 'exprec_test.erl',
  818:     Test = list_to_binary(["-module(exprec_test). "
  819:                            "-compile(export_all). ",
  820:                            Test0]),
  821:     File = filename(Filename, Config),
  822:     Opts = [export_all,return,{outdir,?privdir}|Opts0],
  823:     ok = file:write_file(File, Test),
  824:     {ok, _M, Ws} = compile:file(File, Opts),
  825:     warnings(File, Ws).
  826: 
  827: compile_file_mod(Config) ->
  828:     {filename('exprec_test.erl', Config), exprec_test}.
  829: 
  830: filename(Name, Config) when is_atom(Name) ->
  831:     filename(atom_to_list(Name), Config);
  832: filename(Name, Config) ->
  833:     filename:join(?privdir, Name).
  834: 
  835: warnings(File, Ws) ->
  836:     case lists:append([W || {F, W} <- Ws, F =:= File]) of
  837:         [] -> [];
  838:         L -> {warnings, L}
  839:     end.
  840: 
  841: fail() ->
  842:     ct:fail(failed).
